title: Form Structure Schema
description: A form represented as an array with exactly two items: an array of field objects, and an array containing a single object for general form settings.

items.title: Form Fields
items.description: An array of form field objects. Each field must be one of the available types.

items.title: General Form Settings
items.description: An array with exactly one object containing the general settings of the form.

title.description: The title of the form, displayed prominently at the top.

description.description: Subtitle or descriptive text below the title.
description.example: Basic contact form â€“ enter your name, email, and subject.

formlayout.description: Default alignment of field labels relative to their inputs.

request_cost.description: Field name holding the final calculated cost (must match a field with name pattern 'fieldname[number]').

evalequations.description: When 1, calculated fields re-evaluate automatically on operand changes; when 0, only on manual trigger.

customstyles.description: Custom CSS class definitions to use with 'csslayout' properties. Include '!important' to override.

evalequationsevent.description: 1 = evaluate on 'onchange' only; 2 = evaluate on 'onchange' or 'onkeyup'.

name.description: Unique identifier, must follow pattern 'fieldname' followed by a positive integer (e.g., fieldname1, fieldname42).

fieldlayout.description: Overrides the global form layout for this field. Options: 'default' (use global), 'top_aligned', 'left_aligned', 'right_aligned'.

shortlabel.description: Very short descriptive text for the field (e.g., 'Name').

userhelp.description: Help text or instructions displayed inline or as a tooltip.
userhelp.example: Enter your email in format user@example.com

userhelpTooltip.description: If true, userhelp is shown as a tooltip; otherwise inline.

tooltipIcon.description: If true and userhelpTooltip is true, shows an icon that triggers the tooltip.

csslayout.description: Space-separated CSS class names for custom styling.

hidefield.description: If true, the field is hidden from view.

advanced.description: Advanced CSS styling rules for field components.

rules.description: CSS property-value pairs for the field container.

autocomplete.description: HTML5 autocomplete attribute value. Controls browser auto-fill behavior.

predefined.description: Initial value pre-populated in the field.

predefinedClick.description: If true, predefined value acts as a placeholder (disappears on focus).

required.description: If true, the field must be filled before submission.

exclude.description: If true, the field is excluded from form submission.

accept_html.description: If true, HTML tags in the field value are preserved; otherwise they are stripped (sanitized).

readonly.description: If true, the field cannot be edited by the user.

equalTo.description: Name of another field whose value must match this field's value.

regExpMssg.description: Error message shown when the regex validation fails.

numberpad.description: If true, shows a numeric keypad on mobile devices.

spinner.description: If true, displays spinner buttons to increment/decrement numeric values.

currencySymbol.description: Symbol displayed before the currency value (e.g., '$').

currencyText.description: Currency code displayed after the value (e.g., 'USD').

formatDynamically.description: If true, value is formatted as currency while typing.

twoDecimals.description: If true and formatDynamically is true, enforce two decimal places.

formatDynamically.description: If true, format number as typed (prefix, postfix, separators).

twoDecimals.description: If true and formatDynamically is true, enforce two decimals.

predefinedMin.description: Initial minimum value for range slider (when range=true).

predefinedMax.description: Initial maximum value for range slider.

typeValues.description: If true, show input boxes for manual value entry alongside slider.

marks.description: If true, show tick marks below slider.

divisions.description: Number of tick marks when marks=true.

range.description: If true, slider has two handles (min/max).

caption.description: Dynamic caption with '{0}' placeholder for value(s).

minCaption.description: Fixed caption for left end, with '{0}' placeholder.

maxCaption.description: Fixed caption for right end, with '{0}' placeholder.

disableKeyboardOnMobile.description: If true, prevent manual typing on mobile, force date picker only.

showFormatOnLabel.description: If true, append the date format to the field label.

showDropdown.description: If true, show year dropdown in datepicker.

minDate.description: Minimum allowed date (fixed, relative, or field reference).

invalidDates.description: Comma-separated list of disallowed dates or ranges.

validDates.description: Comma-separated list of allowed dates or ranges.

mondayFirstDay.description: If true, week starts on Monday.

alwaysVisible.description: If true, datepicker is always visible and input is hidden.

timeErrorMssg.description: Custom error message for time validation.

currentDate.description: If true and defaultDate empty, use current date.

defaultDate.description: Default date value (fixed, offset, or relative).

working_dates.description: Array of 7 booleans indicating which weekdays are enabled (starting Sunday).

errorMssg.description: Custom error message for date validation.

disableKeyboardOnMobile.description: If true, prevent manual typing on mobile, force date picker only.

dformat.description: Date format for the date picker.

timeslotsDuration.description: Duration of each timeslot in minutes (1-1440).

preventEarlierSlots.description: If true, disable past dates and timeslots.

maxSlotsPerSubmission.description: Maximum number of slots a user can select.

maxSlotsErrorMssg.description: Custom error for exceeding max slots.

currentDate.description: If true, use current date as default.

minError.description: Error message for not meeting min.

onoff.description: If true, render as on/off switches.

choices.description: Array of display texts for each radio option.

choicesVal.description: Array of values for each radio option.

choicesDep.description: Array of dependency arrays for each choice.

merge.description: If true, merge selected values in calculations (concatenate strings, sum numbers).

select2.description: If true, use Select2 enhanced dropdown.

optgroup.description: Array of booleans indicating if an option is an optgroup label.

accept.description: Comma-separated list of allowed file extensions (e.g., 'jpg,png,pdf').

multiple.description: If true, allow multiple file selection.

dynamic.description: If true, adapt phone format based on selected country.

fields.description: Comma-separated list of field names to include in summary.

fields.description: Array of field names contained in this fieldset.

columns.description: Number of columns to arrange contained fields (1-12).

align.description: Vertical alignment of fields in a row: 'top' or 'bottom'.

fields.description: Array of field names contained in this div.

rearrange.description: If true, rearrange visible fields to fill gaps.

fields.description: Array of field names contained in this popup.

columns.description: Number of columns for inner fields.

titletag.description: HTML tag for popup title (H1-H6 or P).

close_button.description: If true, show a close button.

position.description: Default position: center, top-left, top-right, bottom-left, bottom-right.

data.description: Media configuration object, must contain one of image/audio/video.

beep.description: If true, play beep when recording ends.

preview.description: If true, show preview after recording.

video_width.description: Width of video preview in pixels.

video_height.description: Height of video preview in pixels.

sType.description: Button action: calculate, button, print, submit, reset.

sOnclick.description: JavaScript code to execute on click.

sOnmousedown.description: JavaScript code to execute on mousedown.

eq.description:
A JavaScript expression that dynamically computes the value of a calculated field. The expression is re-evaluated when relevant events occur (onchange, keyup, or calculate button press).

IMPORTANT RULES FOR STRUCTURE:

1. SIMPLE EXPRESSIONS (single line, no variables, no control flow):
   - Use direct expressions WITHOUT wrapping
   - Examples: 'fieldname1 + fieldname2', 'fieldname1 * 0.15', 'Math.max(fieldname1, fieldname2)'
   - Rule: If it's a single expression with no var/let/const/if/else/for/while, DO NOT wrap it

2. COMPLEX CODE (multiple statements, variables, or control flow):
   - MUST be wrapped in a self-invoking function: (function(){ ... })()
   - Required when using: var, let, const, if, else, for, while, switch, or multiple statements
   - Example:
     (function(){
       var principal = fieldname1 - fieldname2;
       var rate = fieldname3 / 100 / 12;
       if (principal <= 0) return 0;
       return principal * rate;
     })()
   - The wrapper is REQUIRED, not optional, for any code with statements

Field Reference Rules:
- Reference fields by name: fieldname1, fieldname2, etc.
- Cannot reference own field name (prevents recursion)
- Special suffixes:
  - '|r': Raw value without preprocessing (e.g., fieldname1|r)
  - '|n': Field name as string (e.g., fieldname1|n)
- For dates: const d = new Date(fieldname1|r);
examples: (function(){ var price = fieldname1; var tax = fieldname2; if (price <= 0) return 0; return price * (1 + tax / 100); })()

(function(){ var principal = fieldname1 - fieldname2; var rate = (fieldname3 / 100) / 12; var months = fieldname4 * 12; if (principal <= 0 || rate <= 0 || months <= 0) return 0; return principal * (rate * Math.pow(1 + rate, months)) / (Math.pow(1 + rate, months) - 1); })()

readonly.description: If true, field is not editable (default true).

currency.description: If true, format as currency (two decimals).

noEvalIfManual.description: If true, manual input overrides further evaluations.

formatDynamically.description: If true, format value as typed (prefix, suffix, separators).

dynamicEval.description: If true, re-evaluate on operand changes.

validate.description: If true, validate after each evaluation.
